overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have an **unknown** stance on the proposed development, as none have made any public statements for or against it. In terms of influence, none are high-profile community figures; one longtime farm couple has moderate local standing, while the others are lower-profile residents.

neighbors.name: Jessica and Evan Blomeyer
neighbors.claims: Jessica and Evan Blomeyer reside in the suburban Piper area of Kansas City, KS, a community known for newer residential developments ([www.emetropolitan.com](https://www.emetropolitan.com/local-market-reports/wyandotte-county-housing-market/#:~:text=Encompassing%20cities%20like%20Kansas%20City%2C,to%20January%20of%20last%20year)). They do not hold any known public offices or leadership roles, and their names are absent from local civic or agricultural records ([wyandottetimes.com](https://wyandottetimes.com/stories/655139418-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-wyandotte-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Farms%20in%20Wyandotte%20County%20received,Department%20of%20Agriculture)) ([www.wyandotte.k-state.edu](https://www.wyandotte.k-state.edu/about/extension_council/#:~:text=2025)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with a neighborly approach, emphasizing that the project will respect their property values and quiet lifestyle.

neighbors.name: Robert K. and Donna L. Creten
neighbors.claims: Robert and Donna Creten are part of a long-established farming family; public business records show "Creten Farms" at their Leavenworth County address was founded in 1966 ([www.manta.com](https://www.manta.com/c/mm7p7vp/creten-farms#:~:text=About)). They own agricultural land in Wyandotte County, but no record was found of them speaking out on development or clean energy issues in local news or meetings ([wyandottetimes.com](https://wyandottetimes.com/stories/655139418-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-wyandotte-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Farms%20in%20Wyandotte%20County%20received,Department%20of%20Agriculture)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected agriculture peer or extension agent initiate dialogue, highlighting how project plans will preserve farmland integrity and honor the land’s legacy.

neighbors.name: Stuart Hunter
neighbors.claims: Stuart Hunter is listed as a Wyandotte County landowner, but he has a very low public profile. His name does not appear in local media reports or public records of community discussions on land use or development ([wyandotteonline.com](https://wyandotteonline.com/72-percent-of-properties-see-increases-in-valuations-in-wyandotte-county/#:~:text=About%2072%20percent%20of%20properties,they%20are%20planning%20to%20appeal)) ([wyandottetimes.com](https://wyandottetimes.com/stories/655139418-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-wyandotte-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Farms%20in%20Wyandotte%20County%20received,Department%20of%20Agriculture)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him through a personal visit by a community liaison, listening to any concerns and assuring him the project will address local needs.
